channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Bong Go: Rationalize bed capacity in DOH hospitals
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: As the health crisis brought about by the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic continues to challenge the healthcare sector, Sen. Bong Go emphasized the need to make the process of increasing the bed capacity and capabilities of the hospitals run by the Department of Health easier and more systematic.

item.title: Oil prices to go up this week
item.author: Danessa Rivera
item.description: Motorists should brace for a massive fuel price increase next week as global crude prices continued to soar.

item.title: SM MOA Arena transformed into mega swabbing facility
item.description: The SM Mall of Asia Arena in Pasay City has recently been converted into a COVID-19 mega swabbing facility.

item.title: Duterte to PMA, PNPA grads: Love your country
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: President Duterte has urged new graduates of the Philippine Military Academy and the Philippine National Police Academy to be loyal to the flag and the Constitution as they embark on the life they have promised to pursue – to protect and serve the people.

item.title: Rapid testing with PCR seen to help restart economy safely
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: Private sector-led initiative Project Antibody Rapid test Kit is pushing for the use of both rapid antibody tests and the Reverse Transcription-Polymerase Chain Reaction tests to allow the economy to safely reopen given the ongoing coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Metro Manila council chair backs downgrade to GCQ
item.author: Ralph Edwin Villanueva
item.description: Parañaque City Mayor Edwin Olivarez, also the concurrent chairman of the policy-making body Metro Manila Council, yesterday pushed for a general community quarantine in the metropolis when the modified enhanced community quarantine lapses on May 31.?

item.title: Most Catholics still afraid to attend mass, says CBCP
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: Many Catholics are still afraid to attend religious gatherings for fear of the coronavirus disease 2019, the Catholic Bishops’ Conference of the Philippines said yesterday.

item.title: Marawi remains a problem – Robredo
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: On the third anniversary of the Marawi City siege, Vice President Leni Robredo called on concerned government agencies to accelerate their response to solve what she described as an “ongoing problem.”

item.title: Philippine to participate in 5 clinical trials for vaccine
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: As the Philippines starts to shift to the new normal after almost two months of lockdown, the Inter-Agency Task Force on the Management of Emerging Infectious Diseases has given the go signal for the Philippines’ participation in at least five clinical trials for vaccines against the coronavirus disease 2019.

item.title: Next cash aid to include 5 million more households
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Around five million eligible households will be included in the second tranche of the Social Amelioration Program, bringing to 17 million the targeted beneficiaries this month, Executive Secretary Salvador Medialdea said yesterday.
